comments.body: Not having any place to store the compiled field selector in v1 makes this uglier than it should be.  We don't need to change it here, but I hit this when moving ListOptions to meta.k8s.io/v1, and felt that it should easier / possible to deal in v1 without this.  Not sure what the best approach is though.
Can we leave the temporary case out of this single block? Otherwise, we won't test the concurrent updates on a single node object, right?
Never mind, I just realized that temporary issue is reported as event, which doesn't update node object.

If so, in the future we can add a test to update the node object with different conditions concurrently. I just use a single `TestCondition` in this test, in fact we can use a randomized condition (such as `TestCondition`+uid) to avoid the conflict. The only concern is that I'm not sure whether the node conditions will be predefined in the future, whether we could add arbitrary string in the condition field. :)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +205,209 @@
			num := 3
			By(fmt.Sprintf("Inject %d temporary errors", num))
			Expect(framework.IssueSSHCommand(injectCommand(tempMessage, num), framework.TestContext.Provider, node)).To(Succeed())
			By(fmt.Sprintf("Wait for %d events generated", num))
